div.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT
S/Sgt. Ann Smith
a-700 158-WAS Det,
Hunter Field. Ga

Mrs. G. W. Carlstead
431 Alleghany
Vallejo Calif.

I mailed you a letter yesterday
morning and received one from you in
the afternoon mail. I mailed G. W. a box
a few days ago. Hope he can wear the
jacket. I'll see if I can't get (cut my finger)
him a raincoat. In the army you
call it racking it off. I try to stay in
good with Quartermaster Sulfit I get
almost anything I ask for. I will have
to say. I sure get along good here with
everyone. I guess I just got off on the
right foot. You said you had a scrap
book so I am sending you my first Cpl.
stripes. My [?bunk?] Sgt. The blue stain is
SOS (Services of Supply) the next I wore was
the wings (Air Corps) the 3/Third Air Force) thats
the one I am wearing now. I am sending

you a picture. I thought it was pretty
good. I had some good pcitures taken
the other day. I hope they are good.
What are the boys doing? I sure would
like to see them. I had a letter from
[Louis?] yesterday and he was very much
tore up. His mother died last Sunday.
Have you wrote to Grandma? If you
haven't, do so. My Cpl. called me last
night + told me he had a letter from
you + was very much thrilled. If we
get just enough letters we are happy.
Plenty to eat + good eats too. Butter
every meal in fact we are not wanting
for any thing. I got a new winter
suit. Pretty sharp. Guess I better get going
because I've got a lot to do. Write often.
Take care of the boys + tell G. W. "Hello"
